rationales.self_direction: Marc did not assert his own voice when Pieter talked over him and presented his proposal as his own; he 'just sat there' rather than calling it out.
rationales.power: Failed to defend his authority or claim credit for his own container routing proposal; passively allowed Pieter to take ownership in front of the steering committee.
rationales.conformity: Restrained himself from confrontation in the meeting despite being angry, choosing not to disrupt the social setting.

rationales.achievement: Ran the quarterly review solo with his own numbers and narrative, demonstrating competence; the room 'was quiet in that good way where people are actually listening.'
rationales.power: Commanded the room by presenting alone with no slides from anyone else; felt the division was 'finally mine in the way I wanted it to be,' asserting full ownership and authority.

rationales.self_direction: Unable to act autonomously on a standard supplier agreement; forced to wait on another department's timeline despite running a 43-person division.
rationales.power: Reduced to 'refreshing my inbox like some junior waiting for permission'; his authority was insufficient to move a routine contract through, and he held back from escalating to the CEO.
rationales.conformity: Held back from going directly to the CEO and followed proper channels despite believing he should have escalated.

rationales.power: Had already unilaterally decided the reporting structure two weeks prior; let Thomas's team talk for ten minutes then moved on, maintaining control of the agenda.
rationales.benevolence: Dismissed Lotte's attempt to connect over dinner, saying 'fine' without engaging; 'didn't have the energy to translate the day into something she'd find interesting.'

rationales.self_direction: Abandoned his own fleet optimization plan when the room shifted to Sandra's approach; his response reveals it was no longer 'my call.'
rationales.power: Lost control of the decision as the room visibly shifted to Sandra; his nudge response confirms what stung: 'they looked at her like she was in charge of the decision.'
rationales.conformity: Went along with the group consensus rather than fighting for his original plan, even though he felt the loss of authority.

rationales.self_direction: Did not assert his own expertise or perspective when Jeroen reframed his analysis back to him; 'I just sat there and let him reframe my own analysis back to me.'
rationales.power: Allowed a junior hire of eight weeks to interrupt and condescend to him without pushback; his response identifies what he is losing: 'The room's assumption that I'm the one who decides.'
rationales.conformity: Smiled and nodded as if it were a 'collaborative discussion' rather than challenging Jeroen, maintaining social smoothness at the cost of his authority.

rationales.power: Actively corrected Pieter this time when he spoke over him in the client call, reasserting his authority after previous instances of passivity.
rationales.conformity: The correction 'came out sharper than I meant and the client noticed,' breaking social smoothness in a professional setting.

rationales.power: Marc reflects that giving clear direction is when he feels 'most like myself'; the mentoring act reinforces his role as the authoritative figure people come to for guidance.
rationales.benevolence: Patiently walked Lisa through the reporting system, shared his own struggles with it to put her at ease, and made her laugh — a concrete act of caring for a close team member.

rationales.power: Forced to 'audition for the right to present my own results' by the CFO, who singles him out but not Pieter or Sandra; complied submissively despite feeling demeaned.
rationales.conformity: Complied with the CFO's request, went through numbers line by line, smiled, and answered follow-ups — maintaining professional decorum despite perceiving disrespect.
rationales.benevolence: Told Lotte he was okay when he wasn't, shutting her out emotionally after sitting alone in the car for ten minutes; withheld his actual state from his wife.
Proactively booked a table at De Kas for Lotte's birthday, showing care and consideration for his wife's well-being.
